curam.util.cache

Class CacheManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.cache.CacheManager

  • public final class CacheManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the entry point for clients using the caching service.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultCacheGroup

        public static CacheGroup getDefaultCacheGroup()
        This method returns the default cache group. Caches from this group are global (JVM level) and can be configured to be distributed across a number of JVMs.
        Returns:
        the default cache group

      • getCacheGroupFactory

        public static CacheGroupFactory getCacheGroupFactory()
        This method returns the cache group factory. This can be used to create a new group of global, distributed caches outside the control of Curam Cache. If you want to create a cache group managed by this cache manager, use CacheManager.createCacheGroup(String, InputStream) instead.
        Returns:
        the cache group factory

      • createCacheGroup

        public static CacheGroup createCacheGroup(java.lang.String name,
                                          java.io.InputStream configuration)
                                   throws CacheGroupNameAlreadyExists,
                                          InvalidCacheGroupName
        Creates a cache group with the given name and using the configuration from the configuration stream. The cache group is also registered with the cache manager. This means that the cache group can be managed via the standard mechanism offered by Curam Cache.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cache group. The name of a cache group must not contain the dot ('.') character otherwise a InvalidCacheGroupName will be thrown.
        configuration - the stream with configuration data for the cache group
        Returns:
        the newly created cache group
        Throws:
        CacheGroupNameAlreadyExists - thrown when a cache group with name name already exists
        InvalidCacheGroupName - thrown when the name of the cache group is not valid

      • getCacheGroup

        public static CacheGroup getCacheGroup(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the managed cache group with name name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cache group to retrieve
        Returns:
        the managed cache group with name name

      • getCacheGroupNames

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getCacheGroupNames()
        Returns the names of all registered cache groups.
        Returns:
        the names of all registered cache groups

      • getCacheGroups

        public static java.util.Collection<CacheGroup> getCacheGroups()
        Returns all registered cache groups.
        Returns:
        all registered cache groups

      • getThreadLocalCacheGroup

        public static CacheGroup getThreadLocalCacheGroup()
        This method returns the cache group for thread local caches. Note that the returned cache group is a thread local variable. Invoking this method twice on different threads will return different cache groups.
        Returns:
        the cache group for thread local caches

      • createThreadLocalCacheGroup

        public static CacheGroup createThreadLocalCacheGroup()
        Use this method to create a thread local cache group when you are already in a thread local context. For instance, if you have an instance of class A that is already a thread local and you need a thread local cache, use this method to create one to be used by this instance of class A.
        Returns:
        a newly created thread local cache group that must only be used in the thread local context of the caller

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        Curam Cache requires orderly shutdown. This method must be invoked before the application is shutdown. This method invokes CacheGroup.shutdown() on every registered cache group and it resets the entire caching environment. If Curam Cache is used after this method has been invoked, a new set of empty caches are created.
        In an application server environment, the application infrastructure will invoke this method when the application shuts down.
